item.title: Habakkuk 1
item.description:
Habakkuk Chapter 1

1 The Oracle That Habakkuk the Prophet Saw Habakkuk’s Complaint

2 How long, Yahveh, will I call out for help, and you won’t listen? I cry out, “Violence!” but you don’t protect me.

3 Why do you make me watch wickedness? Destruction and violence go on right in front of me; fighting and arguing keep getting worse and worse.

4 The courts ignore the Law, so they don’t render justice; sinners are in the majority, so they pervert justice. Yahveh’s Answer

item.title: Habakkuk 2
item.description:
Habakkuk Chapter 2

1 I’ll stand at my post and watch; I’ll station myself on a watchtower to see how he’ll answer my complaint. Yahveh’s Second Answer

2 Yahveh’s second answer: “Write down this vision, etch it on tablets so the messenger can run with it.

3 The vision is still for a future time; it speeds toward the goal and won’t fail. Though it seems slow, wait for it; it will certainly come in due time. 4"Arrogant people aren’t righteous, but the righteous will have life by his trust in me.

item.title: Habakkuk 3
item.description:
Habakkuk Chapter 3

1 A Prayer of Habakkuk Set to Shigionoth

2 Yahveh, I’ve heard about you and stand in awe. Revive your work in our time and show what you can do; in your anger remember mercy.

3 God is coming from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. His brilliance covers the sky; his praise fills the earth.

4 His brightness shines like sunshine; lightning bolts flash from his hand where his power lies hidden.
